title: le Cafe Martin font
content:
Hi everyone.

Trying to identify the font used in the le Cafe Martin print.

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803023223im_/http:/typophile.com/files/martin_6417.jpg)
author: schmoopy.design

comments.content:
Similar to [ITC Juanita](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803023223/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/juanita/fonts/). Also Broadway. From Art Deco era. I should know this one.

- Mike Yanega

[Ultramodern Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803023223/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/ultramodern-classic-sg/) is also similar.

Although I have seen a lot of similar-looking styles, I have not found a match. I also looked in the Solotype Catalog, and didn't see this same style, so I am starting to think it may be custom.

- Mike Yanega
Thanks Mike! These are a great start. I thought that this might be a custom font, but the ones you pointed me to look pretty close.
It probably is a custom-drawn face, but there are plenty of fonts out there that match it. Just do a Google search for "art deco fonts" and you'll find something.

You might also like one of those ...

[Milton Burlesque NF](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803023223/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/milton-burlesque-nf/)  
 [Broadway EF](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803023223/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/broadway/)  
 [Schildersblad Capitals](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803023223/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/schildersblad_capitals/)  
 [PAG Bankas](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803023223/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/prop-a-ganda/pag-bankas/)  
 [Dusty Rose NF](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803023223/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/dusty-rose-nf/)

Phatt Phreddy from Nick's Fonts is also similar.

--- Tamas Ferencz ---
